intro: Dudleya eastwoodiae, commonly known as Eastwood's liveforever, is a succulent plant native to California. It belongs to the Crassulaceae family and is characterized by its thick, fleshy leaves that store water, adapting it to arid environments. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and has a low, spreading growth habit. It produces clusters of small, star-shaped flowers in shades of pink or white during the spring. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and valuable species in horticulture.
